lines.content: *  The main class of the chatbot.
*  The class responsible for interpreting user input commands.
* The enum representing the possible commands supported by the chatbot.
* Excludes the "bye" and "help" command, which are in the main class.
* Parses the user input to determine which command it is.
* @throws UnknownCommandException If the command is not in the Command enum.
public Command parseCommand(String input) throws UnknownCommandException {
throw new UnknownCommandException("That is not a recognised command!");
* Parses the task number from the input string.
* @param commandText The command text to be trimmed. Either "mark ", "unmark ", or "delete ".
* @throws InsufficientDetailsException If the task number is not provided or invalid.
public int parseTaskNumber(String input, String commandText)
throw new InsufficientDetailsException("I need a task number!");
* Parse the details of the ToDo task from the input string.
* @param commandText The command text to be trimmed. In this case, "todo ".
* @throws InsufficientDetailsException If the description is missing
public String parseTodoDetails(String input, String commandText)
throw new InsufficientDetailsException("I need a description for a todo!");
* Parse the details of the Deadline task from the input string.
* @param commandText The command text to be trimmed. In this case, "deadline ".
* @return An array containing the description and the due date
* @throws InsufficientDetailsException If description or due date is missing
public String[] parseDeadlineDetails(String input, String commandText)
throw new InsufficientDetailsException("You need to provide a description "
+ "and a due date for a deadline!");
* Parse the details of the Event task from the input string.
* @param commandText The command text to be trimmed. In this case, "event ".
* @return An array containing the description, the start and the end.
* @throws InsufficientDetailsException If description, start or end are missing.
public String[] parseEventDetails(String input, String commandText)
throw new InsufficientDetailsException("You need to provide a description, "
+ "a start and an end for an event!");
* Parse the keyword from the input string.
* @param commandText The command text to be trimmed. In this case, "find ".
* @return The keyword to search the list with.
public String parseFindKeyword(String input, String commandText)
throw new InsufficientDetailsException("You need to provide a keyword!");
* Handles reading and writing tasks in the file ./data/joseph.txt.
* Converts a task to its string representation.
* @param task The task to be converted.
* @return The string representation of the task.

* Saves the list of tasks to the specified file.

* Loads the list of tasks from the specified file.

* Deadline class that extends from Task, with additional due timing.
* @param desc The description of the deadline. Should be passed in as a String.
* @param due The due timing of the deadline. Should be passed in as DD/M/YYYY HHmm.
DateTimeFormatter formatter = DateTimeFormatter.ofPattern("MMM dd yyyy, h:mm a");
* JEvent class that extends from Task, with additional start and end timings.
* @param desc The description of the event. Should be passed in as a String.
* @param start The start timing of the event. Should be passed in as DD/M/YYYY HHmm.
* @param end The end timing of event. Should be passed in as DD/M/YYYY HHmm.
public JEvent(String desc, String start, String end) {

* Abstract class that provides the skeleton for the Todo, Deadline and Event classes.

* Deletes a task from the task list.
* @param index The index of the task to be deleted. User input is 1-indexed.
* @throws IndexOutOfBoundsException If no task exists at the specified index.
public Task deleteTask(int index) throws IndexOutOfBoundsException {
* Retrieves a task from the task list.
* @param index The index of the task to be retrieved. User input is 1-indexed.
* @return The task at the specified index.
* @throws IndexOutOfBoundsException If no task exists at the specified index.
public Task getTask(int index) throws IndexOutOfBoundsException {
* @param index The index of the task to be marked. User input is 1-indexed.
* @throws IndexOutOfBoundsException If no task exists at the specified index.
public void markTask(int index) throws IndexOutOfBoundsException {
* Unmarks a task as not done.
* @param index The index of the task to be unmarked. User input is 1-indexed.
* @throws IndexOutOfBoundsException If no task exists at the specified index.
public void unmarkTask(int index) throws IndexOutOfBoundsException {

* Prints the welcome message when the chatbot is started.
* @param name The name of the chatbot.
System.out.println("How can I help you today? (type help for all commands)");
* Prints the exit message when the chatbot is closed i.e. the "bye" command.
* Prints the current list of tasks.
* @param list The list of tasks within ./data/joseph.txt.
* Prints a help message showing all available commands. Command is "help".
System.out.println("mark X, where X is any number: "
+ "marks task X on the list as completed");
System.out.println("unmark X, where X is any number: "
+ "unmarks task X on the list as uncompleted.");
System.out.println("The below todo, deadline and event commands "
System.out.println("The below deadline and event commands "
+ "accepts a due or start and end "
+ "adds a deadline to the list with its due date");
+ "adds an event to the list with its start and end");
* Prints a message to indicate that the task as been marked as done. Command is "mark X".
* @param taskDetails The details of the task being marked.
System.out.println("Great, I've marked " + taskDetails + " as done!");
* Prints a message to indicate that the task has been unmarked. Command is "unmark X".
* @param taskDetails The details of the task being unmarked.
System.out.println("Okay, I've unmarked " + taskDetails + " as not done!");
